articles.title: Thai Prime Minister Supports Struggle of Korean People
articles.content:
Thai Prime Minister Supports Struggle of Korean People 
     Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra wished the Korean people greater success in building a rich and powerful country and accomplishing the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of  Kim Jong Il, when DPRK Ambassador O Song Chol paid a courtesy call on him on November 25.
 On the occasion the prime minister said that the government of Thailand is well aware of the stand and sincere efforts of the DPRK government to ensure peace and security in the Korean peninsula and expresses full understanding of them.    
 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, which had developed on good terms in the past, were strengthened still further by the Thailand visit of President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam last year, he said, adding: The Thai government will actively strive to continue developing the good relations.

Commitment of Police force to Area of Demonstration Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Commitment of Police force to Area of Demonstration Denounced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- The "National Federation of the Poor" in south Korea reportedly made public a statement on November 25, denouncing the authorities for committing police force to Puan area.
 The statement charged that the authorities' commitment of over 8,000-strong police force to Puan area where candlelight demonstration was on for over 120 days is a foolish move to create a martial law-charged fear among the residents in the area who oppose the construction of a nuclear waste disposal ground.    
 The authorities should withdraw the police force from Puan County and totally repeal the plan for the construction of a nuclear waste disposal ground, the statement said, warning that in case this demand is not met, the candlelight of Puan would burst into flames of resistance in all parts of south Korea.

Greetings to President of Central Africa
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Central Africa 
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on November 28 sent a message of greetings to Francois Bozize, president of the Central African Republic, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, the government and the people of Central Africa and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger in the mutual interests of the two peoples.    
 It sincerely wished the president and the people of Central Africa greater success in their work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: First Honorary Gold Mark and Certificate to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
First Honorary Gold Mark and Certificate to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with the first honorary gold mark and certificate by the Hungarian Workers' Party.
 They were handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the party, on a visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall yesterday.    
 The chairman said that the party decided to award its first honorary gold mark and certificate to Kim Jong Il in recognition of the immortal exploits he has performed for the socialist cause in Korea and the cause of the world peace.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Hungarian Guests
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Hungarian Guests
    Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met with Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall yesterday.
 The chairman said that their visit to the DPRK has provided them with an opportunity to learn about the vitality of the Songun politics, adding that thanks to leader Kim Jong Il's Songun politics the DPRK has firmly defended Korean-style socialism and stood as a beacon of hope for the world progressives.    
 It is entirely thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK enjoys a high international authority and the United States fancying itself the world's only "superpower" dares not to provoke it.

Greetings to Prime Minister of Barbados
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Barbados
    Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Owen Arthur, prime minister of Barbados, on the occasion of the 37th anniversary of its independence.
 Wishing him and the people of Barbados great success in their work for the prosperity of the country, the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms.
